title: Chaos and Panic Grip Tehran as Airstrikes Shake City
summary: Iranians were beginning their workweek as U.S. and Israeli strikes sent people fleeing parts of the capital and parents racing to collect children from schools.

title: What to Know About the U.S. Attacks on Iran
summary: The United States and Israel launched a major assault, as President Trump called on Iranians to overthrow the government.

title: Elite Doctors Served Jeffrey Epstein While Treating His ‘Girls’
summary: A small stable of doctors gave V.I.P. medical services to the sex offender and the women around him. Some doctors bent or broke the ethical rules of their profession.

title: QAnon Faithful See Validation in the Epstein Files
summary: The nearly decade-old conspiracy theory does not align neatly with the facts emerging from the documents. That does not seem to matter.

title: Epstein Effort to Finance a Dick Cavett Film Undone by Background Check
summary: Jeffrey Epstein joined Mr. Cavett’s wife in an effort to create a PBS documentary on the talk-show legend. But then the producers did a background check on the financier.

title: Kash Patel’s Girlfriend Seeks Fame and Fortune, Escorted by an F.B.I. SWAT Team
summary: Former F.B.I. officials say Mr. Patel beefed up field office staffing near his girlfriend in Nashville and ordered a team to ferry her on errands and to events.

title: OpenAI Reaches A.I. Agreement With Defense Dept. After Anthropic Clash
summary: The deal came hours after President Trump had ordered federal agencies to stop using artificial intelligence technology made by Anthropic, an OpenAI rival.

title: A Tale of Two Seasons at Columbia, and Two Responses to Student Arrests
summary: When Mahmoud Khalil was detained by immigration agents last year, the university’s response was restrained. It was different with Elmina Aghayeva this week.

title: Pentagon Watchdog Stalls Proposal to Review Targeting in Trump’s Boat Strikes
summary: A new inspector general delayed a decision on whether to approve the project and is said to have raised its potential political ramifications, in a test of the watchdog system in President Trump’s second term.

title: The Bloody Rise and Fall of Mexico’s Top Crime Boss
summary: El Mencho’s brutality and business acumen put him atop the cartel world, until he made a fatal mistake.

title: How The Times Covers Cartels and Other Criminal Enterprises
summary: Cultivating sources. Verifying claims. Staying safe. After the death of El Mencho, four journalists share their approach to this difficult, dangerous work.

title: Abrupt Change for Warner Bros. Prompts Many Grim Faces
summary: Employees at the company had started to warm to the idea of Netflix as its corporate owner. Now they face the prospect of major cuts under Paramount.

title: Netflix Lost Warner. Maybe That’s a Good Thing.
summary: It is entirely possible, analysts say, that Netflix will be better off by bailing from its $83 billion deal with Warner Bros. Discovery.

title: Why Have You Started This War, Mr. President?
summary: Donald Trump promised voters that he would end wars, not start them.

title: The President of War
summary: The U.S. military was once a tool of last resort for American presidents.

title: The United States and Israel Attack Iran
summary: The country is retaliating, and the Middle East is in crisis.

title: Berkshire Hathaway Posts a Drop in Earnings in Buffett’s Last Year
summary: In his first report as C.E.O., Gregory Abel, stuck to a straight commentary rather than Warren Buffett’s folksy tone. The lower earnings were largely driven by declines in the insurance business.

title: Fighting Wildfires Could Soon Get Harder
summary: Simultaneous emergencies in different parts of the world could stop countries from sharing ground crews and equipment, new research warns.

title: Lloyd Blankfein on Trump, Epstein and Life After Goldman Sachs
summary: In a wide-ranging interview with Andrew Ross Sorkin, Goldman’s former C.E.O. discussed his life and new memoir.
